case_vignette: A 29-year-old male presents with painful genital ulcers ongoing for the past 3 months. He reports multiple new female sexual partners and unprotected sex. He has tried over the counter antifungal creams without any relief. Physical examination reveals five painful, purulent well demarcated ulcers with yellow fibrinous bases along the penile coronal sulcus and dorsal shaft. Tender bilateral inguinal lymphadenitis is appreciated. A rapid HIV test is performed and is negative.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have painful sores on my genitals that have been there for 3 months.
Have you noticed any discharge or itching in the area?
Yes, the sores have yellowish pus in them.
Have you had any sexual activity recently?
Yes, I've had multiple new female sexual partners and unprotected sex.
Have you had any other symptoms such as fever, chills, or fatigue?
No, just the painful sores and some swelling in my groin area.
Have you had any history of sexually transmitted infections (STIs)?
I didn't mention any history of STIs.
Have you had any other medical conditions or allergies?
I haven't mentioned any other medical conditions or allergies.
Have you had any family history of genital sores or other skin conditions?
I haven't mentioned any family history of genital sores or other skin conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Genital Herpes.
